item.title: APR vs. Rate in Texas: Why You're Probably Overpaying
item.description:
APR vs. Rate in Texas: Why You’re Probably Overpaying

Walk into any Texas mortgage lender and ask for their “best rate.” You’ll hear: “5.875% conventional!” Sounds great—until you see the Loan Estimate and realize the APR is 6.45%. What happened?

You just got hit with the oldest trick in the mortgage playbook: rate vs. APR confusion. Here’s how to spot it, avoid it, and save thousands.

What’s the Difference Between Rate and APR?

Interest Rate = the percentage you pay on the loan balance annually APR (Annual Percentage Rate) = the true cost of borrowing, including rate + fees

item.title: Florida Refinance Closing Costs: What You'll Pay and How to Compare Lenders
item.description:
Refinance closing costs can run $3,000–$8,000+ in Florida, depending on your loan size and lender. Here’s what you’re actually paying for—and how to shop lenders without getting ripped off.

What’s Included in Refinance Closing Costs

Closing costs break into three categories: lender fees, third-party fees, and prepaid/escrow items.

Lender Fees (Negotiable)

Origination Fee (0.5–1.5% of loan amount) What the lender charges to process your loan. Some lenders call this “points” or “loan discount fees.” This is where shopping pays off—rates vary wildly.

item.title: What Nobody Tells You About Closing Costs Until You're Already Under Contract
item.description:
Three days before my closing, I got the final Closing Disclosure from my lender. I expected to pay around $8,000 in closing costs based on the Loan Estimate I received weeks earlier. The actual number? $12,347.

I was stunned. Where did the extra $4,347 come from? And why didn’t anyone warn me about these costs earlier?

After furiously Googling, calling my lender, and negotiating with vendors, I managed to reduce my closing costs by $2,100—but I still paid more than I expected. Looking back, I realize I could have saved even more if I’d known what to look for and what to negotiate from the beginning.
